website_summaries.verdict: A capable, low-priced router with many satisfied owners.
pros: Could be used with a router table
cons: No plunge facility (and, therefore, less flexibility)

customer_reviews.title: Economical dedicated cutting station motor.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 1/2" shank router motor to dedicate for a particular panel bit for long term repeatable cuts. This was a perfect find, in fact this cost me 30% of what the router bit cost. It has a strong smooth running motor which seems to be working well for my stationary panel cutting unit. Much cheaper alternative than buying a pre-made shaper unit.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great design at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I use this router to route electric guitar bodies and it works very well. The LEDs around the bit are very helpful as is the clear plastic plate at the bottom. I also like the way it ramps up to speed. The chuck lock is a great feature too and it keeps you from having to juggle two wrenches when changing the bit. I've not had any issues with the depth adjustment moving--it's as solid as can be--but I don't ever use it with a table.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Raven

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Mounted this to a SKIL router table. Used it to cut 1/4" straight groove in a frame for a cabinet door out of 1 x 2 pine. Seemed to strain more than I had expected. Adjustment knob could be bigger. Seems to be a little too small, which makes it hard to turn. All in All, though, a good purchase and I am satisfied. Good, inexpensive router.
customer_reviews.author: Aragorn the Wiser

customer_reviews.title: Met my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Not fancy with a lot of controls & no plunge capability but a good, reliable router at a great price. I have used it for making pre-hung doors and various other projects. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: K. R. Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Skil 1/2" collet router
customer_reviews.text: Amazing router. The start up and speed are fantastic. The power was also incredible. I use it primarily for putting tongue and grove edges on 3/4 " oak flooring.
customer_reviews.author: D. VANDERAARDE

customer_reviews.title: No edge guide
customer_reviews.text: The router is ok the problem is,you cannot get an edge guide for it.The one that fits it is obsolete ,and no one has them.From now on I will go with Dewalt or Porter Cable or some other well known brand.
customer_reviews.author: james oliver

customer_reviews.title: Good Router If You Don't Need Lower or Variable Speeds
customer_reviews.text: This router has worked very well, looks well-built, and does what I want it to do. There is one limitation, however, that a prospective purchaser might want to consider. This router will handle 1/2" cutters but has a maximum speed of 25,000 rpm. Many 1/2" shank cutters are limited to much lower speeds. Because, like many larger routers, it has "soft start" technology, it will NOT work with most variable speed router control boxes. This potentially limits its usefulness for larger 1/2" shank cutters.
customer_reviews.author: K.J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Basic Router Perfect for Bosch RA1181 Bench top Router Table
customer_reviews.text: Nice Basic router. I like the soft start particularly. I mounted it in my Bosch RA1181 Bench top Router Table router table (it fits perfectly) and am very pleased with this combination.
customer_reviews.author: Rich M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband so he could build me some bookshelves. It does a pretty good job for the price. It has a light in it, which helps with guiding.He's happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband. I really appreciated the price and affordability. Shipping was fast too. He hasn't operated it yet but was really pleased upon receiving it. I expect no problems though when he does go to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Gorman

customer_reviews.title: This router is very sturdy and especially good for larger jobs
customer_reviews.text: This router is very sturdy and especially good for larger jobs. I used it for the finish work for some barrister bookcases and it did a fine job.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for the price- plenty of power and I like the two work lights. Only con is that the lights stay on while pluged in - they should go off and on with the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Gunworks

customer_reviews.title: Danman
customer_reviews.text: excellent router and works very well, i am happy with my purchase and would recommend this product to all DIYERS. after over a year, this baby is still going strong as it remains in my skill router table and has been my work horse for all routing a little trickey to fine tune but with time you learn and its sure works very good. still happy so far. don't be afraid to purchase people it worth the money and its even less than when i purchase
customer_reviews.author: danman bz

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love my router. I have used it a lot and it has become one of my favorite power tools
customer_reviews.author: .357 magnum

customer_reviews.title: Decent Tool
customer_reviews.text: Decent router for the money. I just wanted something for very basic woodworking. It does the job and seems durable.
customer_reviews.author: Dave O

customer_reviews.title: Power Plus!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality router at an even better price. All the power and more than you'll ever need.
customer_reviews.author: wojo

customer_reviews.title: Nice Router
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had much time to use it, but I think it will serve me well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Franz

customer_reviews.title: Liked
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once but I was pleased with the results. I plan to use it soon for other projects.
customer_reviews.author: virginia

customer_reviews.title: I love the price and quality from SKIL  ($58.00 on sale)
customer_reviews.text: Used on 5 home projects already...... Great tool and great company SKIL for home use.
customer_reviews.author: William L. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good Router for the price
customer_reviews.text: Update:I still like this router although finding a plunger base is difficult and not having a variable speed setting is quite limiting. I ended up getting a Craftsman 12 amp router combo for $129 as an upgrade. However if you are lacking in cash this is a very good deal. Limited router accessories . Works well under the Skil Router Table. Nice and smooth, great for bits at 1 1/2 diameter
customer_reviews.author: DavidTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Ok machine machine for the money
customer_reviews.text: Functional but slow to come up to speed and won't attach to my old table otherwise gets the job done shipping was quick.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Beltman

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: I don't use a router much, so I was hoping the lower priced Skil would meet my needs. works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the soft start feature
customer_reviews.text: Found to be as described seems to work very well. I like the soft start feature.
customer_reviews.author: SDsparkey

customer_reviews.title: Seems good to me
customer_reviews.text: I never used a router before I purchased this. It is very easy to use. Easy to change bits and adjust the depth. I like that you can use both 1/2" and 1/4" bits.
customer_reviews.author: tylioromiosaurus

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Like another user, I've finally started on a project and at the last minute discovered I was missing the 1/4" shank collet. Now I'm trying to find out if the collet is a standard connection and how to go about getting one that fits this machine.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: did not get all parts for router
customer_reviews.text: i rhonda rose purchesed a skill router that said it came with a addapter(collet) from 1/2 to 1/4 i cant even use it without psrt so it was yalls mistake. i do alot of ordering from amazon but last two times didnt get right things now this is missing oarts so if u couldsend me what i paid for!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda rose

customer_reviews.title: hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 other routers but needed a 1/2 inch router. Very difficult to raise and lower compared to my others, Switch is in a VERY bad spot, it cannot be turned on/off without removing one hand from router which is unsafe. Had to order a foot switch. I called customer customer service to find out the spec on a screw they use. They have NO specs at all. Good luck if you need a part. Fortunately I will only need to use this cheap router fpr my current project.
customer_reviews.author: LARRY M.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: Item doesn't work & just purchased as a xmas gift. Very disappointed!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: SKIL 1817 120V 1-3/4 HP Fixed Base Router
product_meta.description:
Skil, 8A, 1-3 or 4 HP, fixed base router, soft start technology for smoother start Ups and increased motor life, 1 or 2" collet capacity for larger profile applications and micro-fine depth adjustment for precise depth measurements, dual position on or off switch for user convenience and better control, quick release button for easy motor adjustments and removal.

AMAZON.COM
Take your home woodworking projects to the next level with the Skil 1817 fixed-base router. Designed for do-it-yourselfers, this router is ideal for rounding and forming smooth edges as well as cutting basic patterns in wood. A micro-fine depth adjustment enables you to make precise, professional-quality cuts, and soft-grip handles make the router easy to hold. Skil's Soft Start technology delivers smooth starts and less kickback. 



Woodworking with Professional-Quality Results
Whether you're a novice woodworker or an adept do-it-yourselfer, the Skil 1817 fixed-base router is ideal for cutting basic patterns in wood as well as rounding and forming edges. The tool's fixed-base design enables you to set the cut depth before you turn on the tool. A micro-fine depth adjustment allows you to make precise cuts for professional-quality results. 

Designed for Comfort and Convenience
The Skil 1817 fixed-base router is built to be easy to operate for extended periods, with a design that doesn't intimidate beginners. Comfortable soft-grip handles reduce fatigue, while an LED SiteLight improves visibility and provides a powered tool alert. A dual-position on/off switch offers greater convenience and control. The router is also equipped with a quick-release lever that makes it easy to adjust or remove the motor. 

Less Kickback with Soft Start Technology
Thanks to Skil's signature Soft Start technology, the Skil 1817 fixed-base router starts smoothly and gradually increases in speed, rather than jumping right to top speed like other routers. The result is less kickback, better control, and a longer motor life, allowing you to complete more projects. 

The Skil 1817 fixed-base router features a 1/2-inch collect capacity and comes with a 1/4-inch collet adapter for larger profile applications. The tool weighs 7.2 pounds. 

About Skil Power Tools
Skil Power Tools is a leader in portable electric power tools and accessories serving the consumer do-it-yourself and professional construction markets. Founded in 1924 with the invention of the worm drive SKILSAW, Skil now delivers a complete line of power tools designed and engineered to help DIYers achieve home project success, while providing professionals durable, cost-effective tools for the jobsite. 

What's in the Box
One Skil 1817 router motor unit, one fixed base, one chip deflector, one 1/4-inch collet adapter, and one collet wrench. 






FROM THE MANUFACTURER
1817 120V 1-3/4 HP Fixed Base Router. Includes: Aluminum fixed base, chip deflector, 1/4-Inch collet adapter, collet wrench

See more
